      A boolean value

    • userAlredyRegistered

      public boolean userAlredyRegistered(RegisterRequest request)

    • register

      public AuthenticationResponse register(RegisterRequest request)
      The register function takes in a RegisterRequest object, which contains the user's first name, last name, email address and password. It then creates a new UserEntity object with these values and saves it to the database using the repository.save() function. The saveUserToken function is called to save this user's JWT token into Redis so that we can use it for authentication later on.
      Parameters:
      RegisterRequest - request Get the data from the user
      Returns:
      An authenticationresponse object, which is a pojo that contains the access token and refresh token

    • authenticate

      public AuthenticationResponse authenticate(AuthenticationRequest request)
      The authenticate function is responsible for authenticating a user. It takes in an AuthenticationRequest object, which contains the email and password of the user. The function then uses Spring Security's authentication manager to authenticate the credentials provided by the user. If they are valid, it will generate a JWT token and refresh token using our JwtService class that we created earlier on in this tutorial series.
      Parameters:
      AuthenticationRequest - request Get the email and password from the request body </code>
      Returns:
      An authenticationresponse object

    • homePage

      public AuthenticationResponse homePage(AuthenticationRequest request)
      The homePage function is a function that takes in an AuthenticationRequest object and returns an AuthenticationResponse object. The homePage function calls the authenticate method, which authenticates the user's credentials and returns a JWT token if successful. If unsuccessful, it will return null.
      Parameters:
      AuthenticationRequest - request Get the username and password from the request
      Returns:
      An authenticationresponse object

    • refreshToken

      public void refreshToken(jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response) throws IOException
      The refreshToken function is called when the user's access token has expired. The function checks if the refresh token is valid, and if so, generates a new access token for the user.
      Parameters:
      HttpServletRequest - request Get the authorization header from the request
      HttpServletResponse - response Write the response to the client
      Throws:
      IOException

    • errorHandling

      public AuthenticationResponse errorHandling(String str)
      The errorHandling function takes in a string and returns an AuthenticationResponse object. The errorHandling function is used to return an error message when the user enters incorrect credentials.
      Parameters:
      String - str Pass a message to the errorhandling function
      Returns:
      A authenticationresponse object with the error field set to str

      public AuthenticationResponse deleteUser(AuthenticationRequest request) throws UserNotFoundException
      The deleteUser function is used to delete a user from the database. and all hi associated token
      Parameters:
      AuthenticationRequest - request Get the email of the user to be deleted
      Returns:
      An authenticationresponse object
      Throws:
